clinical_study.brief_title: Adult Spinal Deformity Surgery Real-World Functional Activity
clinical_study.official_title: Real-World Functional Activity in Adult Spinal Deformity Surgery

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to measure functional activity and stability in spinal deformity patients utilizing motion analysis testing and accelerometers.

primary_outcome.measure: Motion Analysis Lab - Change in function
primary_outcome.description: Spatiotemporal measures including velocity, step/stride length, step width, single/double support times, and R/L temporal symmetriesm will be used to measure function.

primary_outcome.measure: Motion Analysis Lab - Change in gait
primary_outcome.description: Gait will be measured by segmental and joint range of motion, peak kinetics during walking, and changes in deviation from normal bands using sensory processing measures.

primary_outcome.measure: Motion Analysis Lab - Change in trunk stability
primary_outcome.description: Trunk stability will be measured by EMG frequency content and activation pattern during gait and postural sway.

arm_group.description: Subjects will be assessed in the Motion Analysis Laboratory at Mayo Clinic Rochester and have activity monitored in the free-living environment.

intervention.description: Monitors placed on the waist, thigh, and bilateral ankles. Accelerometry will measure patients' physical activities in the free-living environment for 4 consecutive days. The patients will wear the monitor during waking hours and remove it during sleeping, showering, and swimming time.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Diagnosis of degenerative thoracolumbar deformity
- Deformity correction surgery scheduled with either Dr. Elder or Dr. Fogelson, minimum 4-level fusion with fixation to the pelvis.
